snippet: Tyson has been feeling pressure from animal welfare activists, who have urged the company to move away from cramped cages for pregnant pigs.
abstract: Tyson Foods, nation's largest meat company, announces program to audit how animals are treated on its suppliers' farms; company has come under pressure from animal welfare activists, who have urged it to move away from cramped cages for pregnant pigs.
lead_paragraph: Tyson has been feeling pressure from animal welfare activists, who have urged the company to move away from cramped cages for pregnant pigs.

headline.seo: Tyson Foods to Audit Animal Treatment at Its Suppliers’ Farms
headline.main: Tyson Foods to Audit Suppliers’ Farms
headline.print_headline: Tyson Foods to Audit Suppliers’ Farms
